intro: Euryops virgineus, commonly known as the golden bush, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with narrow, aromatic leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for coastal gardens. Its blooming period occurs in spring and early summer, adding vibrant color to the landscape.
